humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that there are 23 lymph nodes assessed, with 23 of them positive for metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to N3 stage based on the AJCC staging system (New Rule 13). The report also mentions that the lymph node metastases demonstrate multiple foci of extracapsular extension and represent near complete replacement of the underlying nodal architecture. This information further supports the N3 stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has 23 lymph nodes removed, with 22 of them positive for metastatic carcinoma. The largest metastatic deposit in the lymph nodes is 2.1 cm. This information supports the N3 stage.
